Juan,

Not sure if this helps at all, but my thesis work had a C++ implemen=
tation
of competitive coevolution that used Minimal Criterion in some of th=
e
novelty search conditions. I never bothered setting up a github, I've
att=
ached the code and the paper. Feel free to pillage and swipe whatever is
us=
eful.


-Drew

On Sun, Jul 23, 2017 at 8:47 PM, 'Jonathan Brant'
jonathan.c=
harles.brant@... [neat] <neat@yahoogroups.com> wrote:

>
>
> Hi Juan,=

>
>
>
> HyperNEAT excels at exploiting geometric properties of a given dom=
ain. In
> the MCC experiments as well as most of the original novelty searc=
h
> experiments, a maze navigation domain was employed. If the maze navigat=
or
> agent and its corresponding neural substrate was setup such that Hyper=
NEAT
> could exploit placement geometry in the agent=E2=80=99s sensors and =
effectors, it
> seems plausible that HyperNEAT might offer an advantage; ho=
wever, that
> hasn=E2=80=99t been verified empirically for MCC (not sure ab=
out novelty search).
>
>
>
> That being said, the question of whether Hyper=
NEAT or ES-HyperNEAT would
> be better than NEAT is more dependent on the d=
omain in question. If the
> domain is one that would benefit from the expli=
cit geometric encoding, then
> HyperNEAT may be a natural choice. If there =
are no relevant geometric
> regularities in the domain, this may make it di=
fficult to craft a substrate
> and NEAT might be more appropriate. In princ=
iple, either could be used with
> novelty search or MCC.
>
>
>
> Thanks!
>
=
> Jonathan
>
>
>
> *From:* neat@yahoogroups.com [mailto:neat@...=
m]
> *Sent:* Monday, July 17, 2017 3:32 PM
> *To:* neat@yahoogroups.com
> *=
Subject:* [neat] Re: Minimal Criterion Coevolution Experiments?
>
>
>
>
>
>=
 Would implementing HyperNeat and or ES-HyperNeat to the MCC approach
> imp=
rove performance or is plain neat sufficient in this approach? Also
> would=
 novelty search see any improvement with ES-HyperNeat?
>
> 
>

--001a113f492e83052e055505b682

<div dir=3D"ltr">Juan,<div><br></div><div>Not sure if this helps at all, bu=
t my thesis work had a C++ implementation of competitive coevolution that u=
sed Minimal Criterion in some of the novelty search conditions. I never bot=
hered setting up a github, I've attached the code and the paper. Feel f=
ree to pillage and swipe whatever is useful.=C2=A0</div><div><br></div><div=

      <p></p>=
<div class=3D"m_7310224878158933526WordSection1"><p class=3D"MsoNormal">Hi =
Juan,<u></u><u></u></p><p class=3D"MsoNormal"><u></u>=C2=A0<u></u></p><p cl=
ass=3D"MsoNormal">HyperNEAT excels at exploiting geometric properties of a =
given domain. In the MCC experiments as well as most of the original novelt=
y search experiments, a maze navigation domain was employed. If the maze na=
vigator agent and its corresponding neural substrate was setup such that Hy=
perNEAT could exploit placement geometry in the agent=E2=80=99s sensors and=
 effectors, it seems plausible that HyperNEAT might offer an advantage; how=
ever, that hasn=E2=80=99t been verified empirically for MCC (not sure about=
 novelty search). <u></u><u></u></p><p class=3D"MsoNormal"><u></u>=C2=A0<u>=
</u></p><p class=3D"MsoNormal">That being said, the question of whether Hyp=
erNEAT or ES-HyperNEAT would be better than NEAT is more dependent on the d=
omain in question. If the domain is one that would benefit from the explici=
t geometric encoding, then HyperNEAT may be a natural choice. If there are =
no relevant geometric regularities in the domain, this may make it difficul=
t to craft a substrate and NEAT might be more appropriate. In principle, ei=
ther could be used with novelty search or MCC.<u></u><u></u></p><p class=3D=
"MsoNormal"><u></u>=C2=A0<u></u></p><p class=3D"MsoNormal">Thanks!<u></u><u=
></u></p><p class=3D"MsoNormal">Jonathan<u></u><u></u></p><p class=3D"MsoNo=
rmal"><u></u>=C2=A0<u></u></p><div><div style=3D"border-top:solid #e1e1e1 1=
.0pt;padding:3.0pt 0in 0in 0in"><p class=3D"MsoNormal"><b>From:</b> <a href=
=3D"mailto:neat@yahoogroups.com" target=3D"_blank">neat@yahoogroups.com</a>=
 [mailto:<a href=3D"mailto:neat@yahoogroups.com" target=3D"_blank">neat@yah=

ups.com</a><br><b>Subject:</b> [neat] Re: Minimal Criterion Coevolution Exp=
